primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's cosmic plan to include all humanity through the paradoxical mechanism of consigning them to disobedience so that He may show mercy to all.

subject.identificatie: God (The Holy One of Israel / The Judge-Defense Attorney)
tekstueel_bewijs: God has consigned all men to disobedience
God must exclude before he includes
that he may have mercy upon all

zender.identificatie: God's own nature / The Irrevocable Call
tekstueel_bewijs: it is the very nature of God
the gifts and the call of God are irrevocable

ontvanger.identificatie: All humanity (Jews and Gentiles / The Ungodly / The Defenseless)
tekstueel_bewijs: even for those who are the ungodly
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the 'defenseless' receiver who is under indictment.

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Syro-Phoenician Woman (as a model of faith)
tekstueel_bewijs: Christ Jesus... who indeed intercedes for us
the Son of God made himself defenseless
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and Helper (through Christ).
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit; the power of the 'radical vision' and the 'mystery'.

tekstueel_bewijs: the things we human beings do to one another
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power that renders humanity 'desperately corrupt' and 'under indictment,' requiring a divine intervention rather than human effort.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of 'inclusion' and 'defense of the defenseless' as a reflection of the Judeo-Christian tradition.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Believer / Society
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Human inclusion is presented as a 'tradition at work' that stems from God's nature, though the sermon warns it fails if not grounded in the primary program (God's mercy).

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human *impotence* (lack of power) and God's absolute *sovereignty* (power) to save. It is a theology of 'Pouvoir-faire' belonging exclusively to God.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S2 (false human optimism) to S2 (the reality of disobedience/judgment) and finally to S1 (God's mercy that encompasses S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God making S2 (disobedience) the very condition for S1 (mercy).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; sin is treated as a cosmic power that destroys faith in mankind.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is rigorously theocentric. It systematically dismantles human competence and positions God as the sole actor in the drama of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The Republican Party must always be the party of inclusion

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has consigned all men to disobedience that he may have mercy upon all
under the power of sin... desperately corrupt

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Syro-Phoenician woman is used not as a moral example to follow, but as a participant in a demonstration of the 'justification of the ungodly.'
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Jesus uses her to show that faith knows no boundaries.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of self-justification is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God does the work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from political 'inclusion' to theological 'mercy' is handled by contrasting human sentimentality with divine realism.
spanning_punten: The tension between God's exclusion/judgment and His final inclusion.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the Son of God made himself defenseless for the salvation of the world

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Christological and Father-centric work of justification.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total depravity ('None is righteous, no, not one').

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's agency. Humans are actantially 'Receivers' or 'Opponents' (disobedient), never the 'Subject' of salvation.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this balance; it is the hallmark of grace-oriented preaching.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Perhaps more on the 'Vouloir' (the Spirit's work in the believer's desire) to bridge to the secondary program.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Death) is already sufficiently cosmic.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's mercy) clearly grounds the ethics (inclusion).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the active verbs, even when dealing with highly 'moral' or 'political' themes like inclusion.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would look at the use of the Republican convention as an 'opener,' semiotics sees it as a foil to establish the 'Opponent' (human sentimentality).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 9-11; semiotics reveals that the sermon's 'engine' is the transfer of mercy from a Sovereign Sender to a Defenseless Receiver.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model highlights that the 'Defense Attorney' and 'Judge' being the same actant is the ultimate narrative resolution of the tension between Law and Grace.

appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses the 'Subject-switch' from human political effort to divine cosmic action.
